keywords.indexterm: WebApp integrate IBM Content Navigator plugin

body.p: You can integrate an IBM Content Navigator with the . The integration consists of two plugins. The first one is a plugin for the IBM Content Navigator, which contributes an "Open" action that launches for supported XML files. The second one allows to connect to IBM FileNet P8 to access files.

section.title: Installing the IBM Content Navigator Plugin
section.p: To enable this you need to use the plugin located in the icn-plugin.jar file. To install the plugin, use the following instructions:

ol.li: Open the Administration Desktop and go to the plug-ins tab. It lists all the plugins that are already installed in your environment.
Click New Plug-in and specify the path of the plugin.
Configure the oXygen Webapp URL to point to the location where is deployed.

section.title: Installing the Plugin
section.p: Deploy the following the instruction here. Look in the Tomcat console for a message like:
Unzip the oxygen-webapp-ibm-plugin-17.1-SNAPSHOT-plugin.jar file in this folder and restart Tomcat.

section.title: Using the Integration
section.p:
Every time you open a file that is supported by , it will open in a new window in the editor. The behavior depends on the version status of the document, as follows:
Superseded Versions - The file will be opened in read-only mode.
Released Versions - The file will be opened in read-write mode. Save is not allowed unless the file is checked out (you can use the Check out action on the toolbar). If you check out the file after it was opened, the Save action will start working.If you plan to make changes to a document, you are strongly encouraged to check out the file as soon as possible. In fact, it is best is to check it out before opening it in the application.

When you save a checked-out file, you actually save the content of the "Reserved" version of the document. When you are happy with your changes, you can use the IBM Content Navigator interface to check it in using the following instructions:

ol.li: Invoke the contextual menu and choose Check in.
In the What do you want to save? combo box, choose Information about the document (the content is already saved).
Provide the requested information in the displayed form.
